intro: Primula aizoon, commonly known as the Aizoon primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers well-drained soil. Primula aizoon is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to alpine and subalpine habitats.
